Class ObjectExtensions

A few extensions that aid in functional composition.

Inheritance

ObjectExtensions

Enumerate<T>(T)

Turns any object into an IEnumerable with the given value as it's single element.

Maybe<T>(T)

Creates an Option from an unknown source where a null value could be expected. A null value will be interpreted as None. Otherwise, the Option will be in a Some state with the given value.

Declaration
public static Option<T> Maybe<T>(this T value)
Parameters
Type Name Description
T value

The unknown target
Returns
Type Description
Option<T>

An Option in a Some state if the value is not null. Otherwise, in a None state
Type Parameters
Name Description
T
